docs.snippet: John A. Paulson, that Midas of the subprime era, has done it again.     Two years after Mr. Paulson pulled off one of the greatest trades in Wall Street history, with a winning bet against the overheated mortgage market, he has managed to salvage ...
docs.abstract: John A Paulson's flagship Paulson Advantage Fund experienced remarkable come-from-behind showing in 4th quarter, turning doubled-digit loss into double-digit gain; fund is up roughly 14 percent, adding to Paulson's standout reputation among hedge fund managers; photo (M)

headline.main: 4th-Quarter Rally Lifts Hedge Fund To Robust Gains

The stories of the year, from writers who lived through them.

One of the biggest beneficiaries of China's rapid economic ascent is not China at all, but rather its historic rival, occasional enemy and fellow socialist neighbor to the south, Vietnam.     Less than a decade ago, many economists and executives ...
docs.abstract: One of the biggest beneficiaries of China's rapid economic growth is its historic rival, occasional enemy and fellow socialist neighbor Vietnam; many predicted that China's rise would harm Vietnam economically, but nation has instead benefited by becoming part of the vast global supply chain feeding China's manufacturing; photo (M)

headline.main: Vietnam Holds Its Own Within China's Vast Economic Shadow
